Generate.description: Generates a concise answer from the provided context and instruction. Use for extracting or composing short factual answers from passages.
Generate.interface: generate(input: str, instruction: str) -> dict with key 'response' of type str

ScEnsemble.description: Given several candidate textual answers, evaluate and select the most consistent/best option using self-consistency and scoring heuristics.
ScEnsemble.interface: sc_ensemble(solutions: List[str], problem: str) -> dict with key 'response' of type str

SelfRefine.description: Takes a candidate answer and refines it by checking for grounding in the context and improving clarity or correctness.
SelfRefine.interface: self_refine(problem: str, solution: str) -> dict with key 'response' of type str

EarlyStop.description: When selected, terminate the workflow early to avoid running additional operators on this example.
EarlyStop.interface: early_stop() -> dict with key 'terminate' of type bool

Test.description: Performs a lightweight correctness check by comparing a predicted answer to the gold answer using normalization (lowercase, strip punctuation/articles). Useful for quick EM-style checks during experiments.
Test.interface: test(predicted: str, gold: str) -> dict with keys 'correct' (bool), 'predicted' (str), 'gold' (str)
